revision.comment: Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.1)
revision.text:
{{otherpeople}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Infobox golfer | name = Jack Simpson | image = | imagesize = | caption = | fullname = John Simpson | nickname = Jack | birth_date = {{Birth date|1859|12|29|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Earlsferry]], [[Scotland]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1895|7|9|1859|12|29|df=y}} | death_place = [[Edinburgh]], [[Scotland]] | height = | weight = | nationality = {{SCO}} | spouse = | partner = | children = | college = | status = Professional | yearpro = | retired = | extour = | prowins = | pgawins = | eurowins = | otherwins = | majorwins = 1 | open = '''Won''': [[1884 Open Championship|1884]] | wghofid = | wghofyear = | award1 = | year1 = | award2 = | year2 = | awardssection = }} '''John "Jack" Simpson''' (29 December 1859{{cite web | title=Births in the District of Kilconquhar in the County of Fife| work=Statutory Births 436/00 0074 |accessdate=15 February 2015 | url=http://www.scotlandspeople.gov.uk/search/birth/index.aspx | publisher =[[ScotlandsPeople]] |subscription=yes}} â€“ 9 July 1895{{cite web | title=Deaths in the District of Canongate in the Burgh of Edinburgh| work=Statutory Deaths 685/03 0611 |accessdate=15 February 2015 | url=http://www.scotlandspeople.gov.uk/search/death/index.aspx | publisher =[[ScotlandsPeople]] |subscription=yes}}) was a [[Scotland|Scottish]] [[professional golfer]] of the late 19th century. Simpson was born [[Earlsferry]], [[Fife]], and was one of six golfing brothers. He played his golf out of [[Carnoustie]]. He was a powerful but erratic player. He won the 1884 [[Open Championship]] at [[Prestwick Golf Club|Prestwick]] with a score of 160 for 36 holes,{{cite web |url=http://www.theopen.com/en/History/OpenChampions.aspx#player=Jack+SIMPSON |title=1884 Jack Simpson |publisher=The Open |accessdate=16 October 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131016164928/http://www.theopen.com/en/History/OpenChampions.aspx#player=Jack+SIMPSON |archivedate=16 October 2013 |df=dmy-all }} despite taking a nine at his second hole. He did not have any other high finishes at the Open and concentrated mainly on clubmaking. He died unmarried of [[typhoid fever]] in Edinburgh in 1895. ==Major championships== ===Wins (1)=== {|class="wikitable" !Year!!Championship!!18 holes!!Winning score!!Margin!!Runners-up |- style="background:#ABCDEF;" | [[1884 Open Championship|1884]] ||[[The Open Championship]] ||2 shot lead ||78-82=160 ||4 strokes ||{{flagicon|SCO}} [[Willie Fernie (golfer)|Willie Fernie]], {{flagicon|SCO}} [[Douglas Rolland]] |} ===Results timeline=== {| cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" border="1" style="font-size: 95%; border: #aaa solid 1px; border-collapse: collapse;" |- style="background:#eeeeee;" !align="left"|Tournament !1883 !1884 !1885 !1886 !1887 !1888 !1889 !1890 !1891 !1892 !1893 !1894 |- |[[The Open Championship]] |align="center"|T17 |align="center" style="background:lime;"|'''1''' |align="center"|T13 |align="center"|T12 |align="center"|T12 |align="center"|DNP |align="center"|DNP |align="center"|DNP |align="center"|T39 |align="center"|T28 |align="center"|T34 |align="center"|T38 |} *''Note: Simpson played only in [[The Open Championship]].'' DNP = Did not play
"T" indicates a tie for a place
Green background for wins. Yellow background for top-10 ==References== {{reflist}} ==Further reading== *{{cite book |title=British Open Champions |year=1992 |first=Michael |last=Hobbs |series=Chapman's Library of Golf |publisher=Tuttle Pub |isbn=978-1855925564}} {{The Open champions}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Simpson, Jack}} [[Category:Scottish male golfers]] [[Category:Winners of men's major golf championships]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Fife]] [[Category:1859 births]] [[Category:1895 deaths]] {{Scotland-golf-bio-stub}}
